div.bibl: The Reform Advocate, Vol. 75, p. 588, Wk. of June 9, 1928.

body.p: Jacob Lindheimer is dead at the age of 68. Born in Germany, he came to Chicago as a young man. Political recognition came early with his selection as Democratic nominee for South Town collector. He later served as assistant treasurer during the terms of Stuckart, Harry Gibbons and Patrick Carr. When Carr died within a few days of the end of his term, Lindheimer was elected to the office by the Republican County Board.
